result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Edward Sheridan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Edward Sheridan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Edward Sheridan was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not possess any weapons.
The firearm and ammunition used in this case shall be retained by the police agency and destroyed.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence Friday 3/13/15 by 6:00 p.m. to Monday 3/16/15 at 6:00 a.m.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer - IMPOSED AND STAYED for use of Agent for any violation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
